meanings.definition: The act of proving a statement or theory to be false or incorrect.
meanings.sent1: Her refutation of the rumor silenced the gossip.
meanings.sent2: The refutation of his argument was clear and logical.
meanings.sent3: The refutation of the idea that cats can fly was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His refutation of the conspiracy theory was like a sharp sword cutting through lies.
meanings.sent5: The refutation of the myth was so convincing that no one believed it anymore.

meanings.definition: A statement or theory that proves another statement or theory to be false or incorrect.
meanings.sent1: The scientist presented a strong refutation of the old hypothesis.
meanings.sent2: His refutation of her claim left her speechless.
meanings.sent3: The refutation of the theory that the earth is flat was quite unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her refutation of his excuse was like a bright light exposing the truth.
meanings.sent5: The refutation of the conspiracy theory was so clear that no one believed it anymore.
